item.title: MILES Subgraph Miner
item.description:
MILES is a Java tool to discover subgraphs (or network motifs) in a graph (or network) that are significantly associated with a given set of vertices (or nodes) of interest. In other words, the goal is to search for subgraphs that are enriched in a selected subset of vertices compared to the graph as a whole.

Documentation is available in the GitHub README: https://github.com/pmoris/miles-subgraph-miner#miles-mining-labeled-enriched-subgraphs .

Download the latest release here: https://github.com/pmoris/miles-subgraph-miner/releases .

For the associated publication, see:

MILES: A Java Tool to Extract Node-Specific Enriched Subgraphs in Biomolecular Networks. Pieter Moris, Danh Bui-Thi, Kris Laukens, Pieter Meysman. Bioinformatics, 2019. ( doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btz849 )

item.title: Computational skills primer
item.description:
A presentation on the computational skills and tools that are required to avoid common annoyances in bioinformatics. It acts as both an introduction and a compendium of several concepts and caveats, and goes through various scenarios and how to best deal with them. It touches on a wide array of subjects, ranging from reproducible (code) projects, how to keep your Python/R package installation organized, to working on remote servers with ssh. It was created for my research group’s annual workshop/brainstorm retreat (2019).

The slides are available at: https://pmoris.github.io/computational-skills . They were created using the HTML presentation framework reveal.js .

item.title: Bioinformatic scripts
item.description:
An assortment of smallish scripts and packages that I’ve created during my PhD for various bioinformatics tasks.

Biomolecular id remapper

A simple Python script to remap protein or gene identifiers into different formats via the UniProt API. The script automatically splits big queries into smaller chunks and tries to retrieve the results multiple times upon failure. Documentation is available here .

goscripts

A Python package that provides functionality for handling Gene Ontology (GO) data (e.g. parsing and manipulating .obo and .gaf files), including a ready to use script to perform GO enrichment test.

Installation instructions are available here and the full (Sphinx-generated) documentation for this project is available here .

item.title: TCRex
item.description:
TCRex is a web tool for the prediction of TCR–epitope recognition. It can predict TCR–epitope binding for human T cell receptors (TCRs) using TCR beta chain information, i.e. the CDR3 amino acid sequence and the corresponding V/J genes, using random forest classifiers as the underlying models.

This project was a large-scale team effort, and my personal contributions were mainly made to the back end development and server side deployment via containerization.

For the associated publication, see:

Detection of Enriched T Cell Epitope Specificity in Full T Cell Receptor Sequence Repertoires. Sofie Gielis, Pieter Moris, Wout Bittremieux, Nicolas De Neuter, Benson Ogunjimi, Kris Laukens, Pieter Meysman. Frontiers in Immunology, 2019. ( doi:10.3389/fimmu.2019.02820 )
